author: Special Correspondent
text:
Agriculture officials and farmers at the training programme on pest management in groundnut at Semmandapatti Village in Salem.

A large number of farmers participated in the farm school training programme on integrated pest management in groundnut held at Semmandapatti Village in Kadayampatti block recently.

The programme was organised by Agricultural Technology Management Agency.

A. Nazar, Assistant Director of Agriculture, who presided over the inaugural, explained the concept of farm school.

K. Rajendran, Block Technology Manager, explained the importance of season, variety selection, seed treatment procedure of groundnut for achieving good crop.

Seed treatment

Seed treatment was done with bio fungicide pseudomonas and chemical fungicide carbendazim.

M. Muniraju and G. Rathinasamy imparted technical training to the farmers. P. Shanmugavel and P. Muthusamy, Assistant Agricultural officers, also spoke.
title: Training programme in pest management
